page.title: 01Bugbrooke area(Introduction)
page.content: The area covered by this survey is dominated by the large village of {Bugbrooke},whose population now stands at approximately 2600. Despite a recently rapid growth in the size of Bugbrooke,the village has retained much of its original character and many old buildings,including a fine Norman church still survive.Although the village has both a primary school and a fine new comprehensive school,it does lack many of the amenities that a community of this size warrants. The surrounding countryside has been put mainly to agricultural use (both arable and dairy farming). Several major lines of communication cross the area,including the railway link from London's Euston to the North-West,the A5 trunk road and the Grand Union Canal.
